channel.title: Help guys
channel.description: I want to make my own server and no leech. So i should re-edit some1 work or start like on cleanscape and make everything where?

item.title: Help guys
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“pot up pls, post:6, topic:420962”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=523637.msg3809196#msg3809196 date=1320750030]
Start by re-editing someone elses work, see how everything works and pick up a book or two on java. it will really help.

[/quote]
Fggot, made me wipe my screen <3[/quote]
Aren’t I a stinker. :3

item.title: Help guys
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Download someone else’s work. Trust me recreating features when you do not understand the protocol, logic and language will overwhelm you. What I suggest is downloading a source that follows good habits and conventions so you can pick up the ‘game’ the right way, first time around. Sadly server’s written correctly usually lack features. Some sources to take note of are: DeltaScape and Project Insanity. These have a lot of features. The con is most are written very poorly and will teach your horrible habits! It goes without saying that most derivatives (other people’s edits of these sources) will be even worse. I’d take a look at Hyperion (albeit it being overwhelming), or something like RuneSource.

Edit: I missed the point. I suggest downloading Azure v3 or iClarity and making small changes to the game and seeing how your code influences the game. You’ll slowly learn more and more and understand the source. At this point you could customise the game wildly to your imagination taking into considering the client and graphics will probably remain constant unless you hack them up, which I do not advise, being new to this.

Read full topic
